free_limit.description: Optional: Free limit for how many yats the user may purchase

is_active.description: Optional: If the user is active, updating to true triggers user activation related events

refresh_token.description: Refresh token obtained from login request

global_scopes.description: A list of fine-grained permissions the user may perform.

organization_roles.description:
The role this user has in each organisation. Organisations are currently not used, but are reserved for
 future operations.

organization_scopes.description:
The scopes that are granted to this user for each organisation. Organisations are currently not used, but are
 reserved for future operations.

pubkeys.description:
A list of this user's public keys. When yats are deployed to the blockchain, users prove ownership of their
 Yats with digital signatures, proving knowledge of the private keys that "own" the yat. In the centralised
 implementation of Yat, the server will custody the users' wallets and private keys, but in other respects the
 ownership model is the same.

role.description: The role assigned to this user. Roles grant authority to user accounts to perform certain actions.

delete.description: Optional: hashes of records to delete

insert.description: Optional: list of records to add

tag.description: Category ID as a hex number

merkle_root.description: Optional: merkle root (use WASM to generate)

data.description: Category data in text or hex encoded formats

hash.description: Hash identifies record, can be used to delete records

tag.description: Category as a hex string number

status.description:
Response status.
 If true, the requested data will be in the result field, null otherwise

views_past_month.description: Number of times emoji viewed during past month

data.description: The data to pass through to the proxied service

value.description: The response from the proxied service as a String

refresh_token.description: Refresh token obtained from login request

source.description: Required when registering with `alternate_id`, source for non custodial user

availability.description: The availability state of this emoji

available.description: Whether the EID is available for purchase

discounted_price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Discounted price is 0 if the emoji is not available

eid.description: Emoji ID in percent url-encoded form

price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Price is 0 if the emoji is not available

views_past_month.description:
Total lookups using this API, if someone is viewing this EID
 using their own self hosted node, it will not be counted here

result.description: The specific Emoji ID that the user requests

availability.description: The availability state of this emoji

available.description: Whether the EID is available for purchase

discounted_price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Discounted price is 0 if the emoji is not available

eid.description: Emoji ID in percent url-encoded form

price.description:
Pricing in US cents, e.g. 1024 is 10.24 USD.
 Price is 0 if the emoji is not available

views_past_month.description:
Total lookups using this API, if someone is viewing this EID
 using their own self hosted node, it will not be counted here

post.description: Complete login flow when user requires 2FA. `refresh_token` obtained from a call to `/token` or `/token/refresh` should be used to complete authentication. **Note:** 2FA token has expiration timeout, which is when expired sensitive operations would require authentication via 2fa once again.

400.description: Bad request: Request body or parameters are not in the expected format.

401.description: Unauthorized: Access token not found or invalid.

post.description: Will generate and send magic link to provided user's email. Assuming the email address corresponds to a valid user

post.description: Login via username/password. Will return access and refresh tokens. NOTE: when `requires_2fa` is not empty in response, provided "refresh_token" should be used to confirm 2FA code via `POST /auth/2fa`.

400.description: Bad request: Request body or parameters are not in the expected format.

401.description: Unauthorized: Access token not found or invalid.

post.description: Will return updated access and refresh tokens. NOTE: when `requires_2fa` is not empty in response, provided "refresh_token" should be used to confirm 2FA code via `POST /2fa`

get.description: If no parameters provided will return all emojis of current user. When `user_id` or `organization_id` specified will return emojis owned by specified user or organization, requires Admin or organization power user access. Result is array of emojis `["üçó","üåà"]`

400.description: Bad request: Request body or parameters are not in the expected format.

401.description: Unauthorized: Access token not found or invalid.

parameters.description:
Lookup emojis owned by `organization_id`,
 requires organization power user role
parameters.name: organization_id

parameters.description:
Lookup emojis owned by `user_id`,
 requires Admin role
parameters.name: user_id

get.description: Will filter and return data from supplied tags, If tags filter is not supplied will return all tags attached. It will also try to get views for the past month, if not available will return -1. This method is called when a user wants to look up an EID's records such as a crypto address or a redirect

400.description: Bad request: Request body or parameters are not in the expected format.

401.description: Unauthorized: Access token not found or invalid.

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tags to display, skip it to display all, e.g. `?tags=0x0001,0x1001`
parameters.name: tags

patch.description: Add and remove records in EmojiId, update merkle_root and signature too. Access notes: user expected to own the emoji's pubkey, have Admin role or be power member of organization if pubkey belongs to organization, otherwise operation will fail.

400.description: Bad request: Request body or parameters are not in the expected format.

apiKey.name: Authorization
apiKey.description: When user has 2FA configured: JWT token in `Bearer TOKEN` format which has not expired 2FA timeout

tags.name: User Authentication
tags.description:
From a user experience standpoint, we want encourage the use of magic links
1. Users request a magic link
2. If 2FA is enabled submit proceed to 2FA

tags.name: Emoji
tags.description:
Emoji ID endpoints. The most common endpoint will be a lookup `/emoji/{eid}`,
                this is when a user wants to get records associated with an Emoji ID.

tags.name: User Interest
tags.description: User Interest endpoints. Endpoints for users to express interest in Emoji IDs.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: User Management. Only applicable for users with custodial wallets.

info.title: Emoji ID API server
info.description:
Emoji ID is a directory service that associates almost
            any type of structured data with a short, memorable identifier the emoji id.
